definitions.definition: Flexible material in a roll with a sticky surface on one or both sides; adhesive tape .
examples: Hand me some tape . I need to fix a tear in this paper.
I sealed up the box with clear shipping tape .

definitions.definition: Thin and flat paper, plastic or similar flexible material, usually produced in the form of a roll.
examples: We made some decorative flowers out of the tape we bought.

definitions.definition: Finishing tape, stretched across a track to mark the end of a race.
examples: Jones broke the tape in 47.77 seconds, a new world record.

definitions.definition: Magnetic or optical recording media in a roll; videotape or audio tape .
examples: Did you get that on tape ?

definitions.definition: Any video or audio recording, regardless of the method used to produce it.
An unthinking, patterned response triggered by a particular stimulus.
examples: Old couples will sometimes play tapes at each other during a fight.

definitions.definition: The series of prices at which a financial instrument trades.
The wrapping of the primary puck-handling surface of a hockey stick
examples: His pass was right on the tape .

definitions.definition: A strong flexible band rotating on pulleys for directing the sheets in a printing machine.
Liquor , alcoholic drink, especially gin or brandy. ( Especially in prison slang or among domestic servants and women. )
Clipping of red tape ( “ time-consuming bureaucratic procedures ” ) .

main_definition: Flexible material in a roll with a sticky surface on one or both sides; adhesive tape .
secondary_definitions: Thin and flat paper, plastic or similar flexible material, usually produced in the form of a roll.
Finishing tape, stretched across a track to mark the end of a race.
Magnetic or optical recording media in a roll; videotape or audio tape .
( informal , by extension ) Any video or audio recording, regardless of the method used to produce it.
( informal ) An unthinking, patterned response triggered by a particular stimulus.
( trading , from ticker tape ) The series of prices at which a financial instrument trades.
( ice hockey ) The wrapping of the primary puck-handling surface of a hockey stick
( printing , historical ) A strong flexible band rotating on pulleys for directing the sheets in a printing machine.
( possible , obsolete , UK , slang ) Liquor , alcoholic drink, especially gin or brandy. ( Especially in prison slang or among domestic servants and women. )
Clipping of red tape ( “ time-consuming bureaucratic procedures ” ) .
